statements.statement: Wild turkey can run 15+ mph
Thanksgiving was declared a fixed national date by Lincoln
Macy's parade introduced character balloons in the 1920s
The earliest Thanksgiving proclamations varied by state, not federal law
"Turkey trot" races predate the 1900s
Franklin D. Roosevelt moved Thanksgiving to boost the economy
The first Thanksgiving feast was not originally called "Thanksgiving"
Pumpkin pie was served at the 1621 feast
NFL Thanksgiving games began before the Super Bowl era
TV dinner was invented because of Thanksgiving overstock
Cranberries were sweetened with white sugar at the 1621 feast
Thanksgiving once fell on the 3rd Thursday during Roosevelt's change
Thanksgiving wasn't an annual tradition everywhere in the U.S. until after the Civil War
Pecan pie was created in New England
The Thanksgiving turkey pardon was an official televised ceremony before the 1980s
"Spatchcock" turkey prep predates the Thanksgiving turkey stereotype
Thanksgiving has always been the 4th Thursday by law
Pumpkin spice existed before canned pumpkin
The Thanksgiving parade was first broadcast nationally on TV before WWII
Turkeys roosting in trees overnight is true of wild turkeys, not farmed ones
Thanksgiving NFL games inspired the Madden game franchise later, not the other way around
Turkey replaced goose regionally before it replaced it symbolically
Campbell Soup Company invented green bean casserole in the 1950s
Sweet potatoes were common in Thanksgiving menus before white potatoes
Thanksgiving leftovers are the origin of modern frozen convenience meals
John Madden popularized the leg-turkey-six-drumstick obsession
Thanksgiving was briefly rescheduled during WWII due to ration logistics
The parade balloons are filled at ground level but inflated by internal blowers
Thanksgiving date standardization came from Congress, not the President
Thanksgiving football broadcasts air on more networks now than before cable existed
